ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
pyscal is a python module for the calculation of local
atomic structural environments including Steinhardt's bond
orientational order parameters [1] during post-processing
of atomistic simulation data. The core functionality of
pyscal is written in C++ with python wrappers using
pybind11 which allows for fast calculations with possibilities
for easy expansion in python.
about.summary: faster and more efficient pyscal distribution

about.summary: faster and more efficient pyscal distribution

name: pyscal3

about.description:
pyscal is a python module for the calculation of local
atomic structural environments including Steinhardt's bond
orientational order parameters [1] during post-processing
of atomistic simulation data. The core functionality of
pyscal is written in C++ with python wrappers using
pybind11 which allows for fast calculations with possibilities
for easy expansion in python.
about.summary: faster and more efficient pyscal distribution

about.description:
pyscal is a python module for the calculation of local
atomic structural environments including Steinhardt's bond
orientational order parameters [1] during post-processing

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pyscal3" %}
{% set version = "3.3.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/pyscal/{{ name }}/archive/{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 587c6d9f7824d4ebfb23226ba645b626787034a1ab694d548d12ff213a133c68

build:
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  build:
    - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - numpy                                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - pybind11                               # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - numpy                                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - numpy
    - pybind11
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - pip
    - ase
    - pyyaml
    - pybind11

test:
  imports:
    - pyscal3
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://pyscal.org
  license: GPL-3.0
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: faster and more efficient pyscal distribution

  description: |
    pyscal is a python module for the calculation of local 
    atomic structural environments including Steinhardt's bond 
    orientational order parameters [1] during post-processing 
    of atomistic simulation data. The core functionality of 
    pyscal is written in C++ with python wrappers using 
    pybind11 which allows for fast calculations with possibilities 
    for easy expansion in python.
  doc_url: https://v3.pyscal.org
  dev_url: https://github.com/pyscal/pyscal3/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - srmnitc

about.description:
pyscal is a python module for the calculation of local
atomic structural environments including Steinhardt's bond
orientational order parameters [1] during post-processing
of atomistic simulation data. The core functionality of
pyscal is written in C++ with python wrappers using
pybind11 which allows for fast calculations with possibilities
for easy expansion in python.
about.summary: faster and more efficient pyscal distribution
